metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, PHP, Python, Bootstrap, Java and XML.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.code_html:
<template>
  <h1>Dynamic Components</h1>
  <p>App.vue switches between which component to show.</p>
  <button @click="toggleValue = !toggleValue">Switch component</button>
  <component :is="activeComp"></component>
</template>

content.text: The is attribute can be used for three things:
content.html: The is attribute can be used for three things:

content.text: 1. Dynamic components: The is attribute is set on the built-in <component> element to create a dynamic component, where the is attribute defines which component should be the active one.
content.html: 1. Dynamic components: The is attribute is set on the built-in <component> element to create a dynamic component, where the is attribute defines which component should be the active one.

content.text: In more detail, the is attribute is bound to a property with v-bind , and the property holds the name of which component that should be the active one. (See the Example above)
content.html: In more detail, the is attribute is bound to a property with v-bind, and the property holds the name of which component that should be the active one. (See the Example above)

content.text: 2. Replace a native element with a Vue component: is="vue:my-component" is placed on a native HTML element to replace it with a Vue component. (See Example 1)
content.html: 2. Replace a native element with a Vue component: is="vue:my-component" is placed on a native HTML element to replace it with a Vue component. (See Example 1)

content.text: If we do not use the vue: prefix, it will be interpreted as a customized built-in element, as explained right below here, and the Vue component will not be inserted.
content.html: If we do not use the vue: prefix, it will be interpreted as a customized built-in element, as explained right below here, and the Vue component will not be inserted.

content.text: 3. Customized built-in element: Customized built-in elements can be written in JavaScript, and the is attribute can be used on an HTML tag to define it as such a customized built-in element. This is not a Vue feature.
content.html: 3. Customized built-in element: Customized built-in elements can be written in JavaScript, and the is attribute can be used on an HTML tag to define it as such a customized built-in element. This is not a Vue feature.

content.code:
<
template
>


<
h2
>
Example Built-in 'is' Attribute
</
h2
>


<
p
>
The IMG tag below is set to be replaced by a component by the use of 'is="vue:child-comp"'.
</
p
>


<
img

is
=
"
vue:child-comp
"

/>


</
template
>
content.code_html:
<template>
  <h2>Example Built-in 'is' Attribute</h2>
  <p>The IMG tag below is set to be replaced by a component by the use of 'is="vue:child-comp"'.</p>
  <img is="vue:child-comp" />
</template>
